statement:
Let $G$ be a locally compact and $L^1(G)$ its group algebra.

Let $\hat{G}$ denote the Pontryagin dual of $G$ and $\Delta$ the
character space of $L^1(G)$, i.e. the set of multiplicative linear
functionals of $L^1(G)$ endowed with the weak-\* topology.

[**Theorem -**]{} The spaces $\hat{G}$ and $\Delta$ are homeomorphic.
The homeomorphism is given by
$$\omega \longmapsto \phi_{\omega}\;, \qquad\qquad \omega \in \hat{G}$$
where $\phi_{\omega} \in \Delta$ is defined by
$$\phi_{\omega}(f):=\int_G f(s)\omega(s)\;d\mu(s)\;, \qquad\qquad f \in L^1(G)$$
names: dual group of $G$ is homeomorphic to the character space of $L^1(G)$
